item.title: Shelley add a quote by Norman Cousins
item.description: "Laughter is inner jogging." -- Norman Cousins

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Margaret Cousins
item.description: "Appreciation can make a day, even change a life." -- Margaret Cousins

item.title: Shelley add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Those who have a 'why' to live, can bear with almost any 'how'." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Viktor Emil Frankl
item.description: "As for the concept of collective guilt, I personally think that it is totally unjustified to hold one person responsible for the behavior of another person or a collective of persons." -- Viktor Emil Frankl

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I have not the pleasure of understanding you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Laugh as much as you choose, but you will not laugh me out of my opinion." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Better be without sense than misapply it as you do. " -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It's been many years since I had such an exemplary vegetable." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "How quick come the reasons for approving what we like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are people, who the more you do for them, the less they will do for themselves." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Jane Austin
item.description: "Men were put into the world to teach women the law of compromise. " -- Jane Austin

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "You weren't an accident. You weren't mass produced. You aren't an assembly-line product. You were deliberately planned, specifically gifted, and lovingly positioned on the earth by the Master Craftsman." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Bob Hope
item.description: "My idea of Christmas, whether old-fashioned or modern, is very simple: loving others. Come to think of it, why do we have to wait for Christmas to do that?" -- Bob Hope

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I bought my brother some gift-wrap for Christmas. I took it to the gift wrap department and told them to wrap it, but in a different print so he would know when to stop unwrapping." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "In the old days, it was not called the Holiday Season; the Christians called it 'Christmas' and went to church; the Jews called it 'Hanukkah' and went to synagogue; the atheists went to parties and drank. People passing each other on the street would say 'Merry Christmas!' or 'Happy Hanukkah!' or (to the atheists) 'Look out for the wall!" -- Dave Barry

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I have a sort of Christmas-morning sense of the library as a big box full of beautiful books." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "God bless us, every one!" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Christmas a humbug, uncle!" said Scrooge's nephew. "You don't mean that, I am sure?" "I do," said Scrooge. "Merry Christmas! What right have you to be merry? what reason have you to be merry? You're poor enough." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Come, then," returned the nephew gaily. "What right have you to be dismal? What reason have you to be morose? You're rich enough." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Julie Kagawa
item.description: "Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?" -- Julie Kagawa

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "Never forget that anticipation is an important part of life. Work's important, family's important, but without excitement, you have nothing. You're cheating yourself if you refuse to enjoy what's coming." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "We may never become accustomed to untrue and unjust criticism of us but we ought not to be immobilized by it." -- Neal A. Maxwell

item.title: Shelley add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "When man has reached the periphery of the spiderweb of his own reason and logic, he can find the ropes of revelation upon which he can climb upward forever and ever." -- Neal A. Maxwell
